column1: #Text=[0007] Devices and methods for cleaning dirt according to the type mentioned at the outset are known in practice.
#Text=Here, reference is made to DE 43 35 117 C2 as an example.
#Text=In methods of prior art, first a chemical binder and fresh water are applied on the soiled area.
#Text=The binder-water compound is then rubbed into the surface with brushes, and then it is supplied via a suctioning device to a waste water tank.
#Text=This cleaning method is called wet scrubbing.

#Text=[0008] From prior art, additionally pressure washing machines are known, which apply a concentrated water-cleaning solution on the soiled surface under high pressure, in order to release the dirt this way.
#Text=Then, the waste water is suctioned off the area via a suction device.
#Text=[0009] The wet scrubbing method is disadvantageous in that in practice usually several processing steps are required to reach a satisfactory cleaning result.
#Text=The high consumption of concentrated cleaning solution is also disadvantageous, which leads to extreme environmental contamination.
#Text=When cleaning areas via pressure washing, it is problematic that this method needs large amounts of water.
#Text=This leads to high disposal costs for the developing waste water and a short range of operation for the cleaning vehicles.
#Text=In this method it is additionally disadvantageous that by the high water pressure the surface to be cleaned may be damaged.

#Text=[0010] The present invention is therefore based on the objective to provide a device and a method for removing soiling of the type mentioned at the outset equipped and further developed such that with a small amount of cleaning liquid the removal of soiling is possible while using small amounts of cleaning solution and a gentle treatment of the surface, with as little energy as possible being consumed.
